intro: Achyrocline hirta, commonly known as the hairy achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments, making it a halophyte. Its hairy leaves and small yellow flowers are features that help it retain moisture and reduce water loss. It is often found in sandy soils and is considered an important species for coastal vegetation.
